CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Initial Contact stage positioned above or below the Proposal Sent stage?
SRP.A: The Initial Contact stage is positioned {above} the Proposal Sent stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {logarithmic} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Proposal Sent?
VE.A: The value of stage Proposal Sent is {149}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Initial Contact?
VE.A: The value of stage Initial Contact is {352}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Needs Analysis?
VE.A: The value of stage Needs Analysis is {168}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Lead Captured, with a value of {705}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Proposal Sent, with a value of {149}.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Needs Analysis to stage Proposal Sent?
SC.A: Decreased by {19} Clients from stage Needs Analysis to stage Proposal Sent.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 528? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 528? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Initial Contact} stage has {352}, the {Needs Analysis} stage has {168}, the {Proposal Sent} stage has {149}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 158 and 260? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Initial Contact to Needs Analysis, or from stage Needs Analysis to Proposal Sent?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Initial Contact} to {Needs Analysis} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Lead Captured to Initial Contact, or from stage Needs Analysis to Proposal Sent?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Lead Captured} to {Initial Contact} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Initial Contact to Needs Analysis, from stage Needs Analysis to Proposal Sent, or from stage Lead Captured to Initial Contact?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Lead Captured} to stage {Initial Contact} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Lead Captured} and {Initial Contact} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Needs Analysis} and {Proposal Sent} stages.
